name: AGILE
goals: Study the most energetic phenomena in the Universe

name: AstroSat
goals: Multi-wavelength observations of the universe

name: CALET
goals: Investigates possible nearby sources of high-energy electrons, galactic particle acceleration and propagation, and studies Gamma-ray Bursts

name: Chandra
goals: Observe X-ray sources, providing insights into the Universe

name: Fermi
goals: Study the cosmos in the 30 MeV to 10 GeV range with unprecedented sensitivity and spatial resolution

name: HXMT
goals: Observe black holes and neutron stars

name: INTEGRAL
goals: Observe high-energy cosmic sources

name: IXPE
goals: Measure the polarization of X-rays from black holes and neutron stars

name: MAXI
goals: Multi-wavelength observations of the universe

name: NICER
goals: Study the physics of neutron stars

name: NuSTAR
goals: Study black holes, supernovae, and other high-energy objects

name: SRG
goals: Map the X-ray sky

name: Swift
goals: Observe gamma-ray bursts and afterglows

name: XMM-Newton
goals: Observe high-energy cosmic sources

name: Hayabusa2
goals: Sample return mission to explore a C-type asteroid

name: OSIRIS-REx
goals: Sample return mission to study a potentially hazardous asteroid

name: Lucy
goals: Study the diversity of the Trojan asteroids

name: DART
goals: Test asteroid deflection technology

name: LICIA Cube
goals: Assess the results of the DART impact

name: 2001 Mars Odyssey
goals: Mapping the Martian surface and atmosphere to understand the planet's environment and potential for past or present life.

name: Mars Express
goals: Studying the Martian atmosphere, surface, and subsurface to understand its past and present conditions and potential for habitability.

name: Curiosity
goals: Assessing Mars' habitability and searching for potential signs of past or present microbial life.

name: MRO (Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter)
goals: Studying the Martian atmosphere, surface, and subsurface to understand its climate, geology, and potential for past or present water.

name: Mangalyaan (Mars Orbiter Mission)
goals: Demonstrating India's capability to orbit Mars and study the Martian atmosphere.

name: MAVEN
goals: Exploring Mars' upper atmosphere, ionosphere, and interactions with the solar wind to understand how the planet lost its atmosphere.

name: ExoMars Trace Gas Orbiter
goals: Searching for evidence of methane and other trace gases in the Martian atmosphere to understand their origin and potential for biological activity.

name: InSight
goals: Placing a lander on Mars to study its deep interior and understand the planet's formation and evolution.

name: Emirates Mars Mission (Hope)
goals: Studying the Martian atmosphere and climate to understand their dynamics and variability.

name: Tianwen-1
goals: Orbiting, landing, and roving on Mars to conduct scientific explorations of the planet's surface, atmosphere, and geology.

name: Perseverance
goals: Seek signs of ancient life and collect samples for potential return to Earth

name: Ingenuity Helicopter
goals: Test technology for future robotic and crewed missions to Mars

name: ARTEMIS P1/P2
goals: Study the Moon’s surface and environment

name: LRO
goals: Mapping the Moon's surface and searching for resources

name: Queqiao
goals: Providing communication relay for the Chang’e 4 mission

name: Chang’e 4
goals: First landing on the far side of the Moon

name: Chandrayaan-2
goals: Mapping the lunar surface and studying the lunar exosphere

name: CAPSTONE
goals: Testing a unique lunar orbit for future missions

name: Korean Pathfinder (Danuri)
goals: Demonstrating South Korea’s capability for lunar exploration

name: Parker Solar Probe
goals: Trace how energy and heat move through the solar corona and what accelerates the solar wind and solar energetic particles

name: Solar Orbiter
goals: Study the Sun and inner heliosphere

name: Juno
goals: Investigate Jupiter's origin and evolution, atmosphere, and magnetosphere

name: New Horizons
goals: Explore Pluto, its moons, and the Kuiper Belt

name: Voyager 1
goals: Explore the outer solar system and interstellar space

name: Voyager 2
goals: Explore the outer solar system and interstellar space

name: Terra
goals: Monitoring the state of Earth's environment and climate system

name: Aqua
goals: Studying Earth's water cycle, including evaporation from the oceans, water vapor in the atmosphere, clouds, precipitation, soil moisture, sea ice, and snow cover

name: Landsat series
goals: Providing continuous observations of Earth's land surface, supporting sustainable resource management and monitoring changes in land use

name: SOHO
goals: Study the Sun, from its interior to its outer atmosphere and the solar wind

name: STEREO
goals: Provide stereoscopic images of the Sun and study coronal mass ejections

name: Parker Solar Probe
goals: Trace how energy and heat move through the solar corona and what accelerates the solar wind and solar energetic particles

goals: Investigate Jupiter's origin and evolution, atmosphere, and magnetosphere

goals: Explore Pluto, its moons, and the Kuiper Belt

goals: Assessing Mars' habitability and searching for potential signs of past or present microbial life.

name: Planck
goals: Study the early universe

name: WMAP
goals: Map the cosmic microwave background radiation

name: Gaia
goals: Create a 3D map of the Milky Way

name: TESS
goals: Discover exoplanets around nearby stars

name: James Webb Space Telescope (JWST)
goals: Observe the universe in infrared light

name: Chandra X-ray Observatory
goals: Study high-energy phenomena in the universe

name: Hubble Space Telescope
goals: Observe the universe at large

name: Kepler
goals: Discover exoplanets

name: TESS
goals: Discover exoplanets around nearby stars

name: CHEOPS
goals: Characterize exoplanets

goals: Establish a sustainable human presence on the Moon

goals: Mapping the Moon's surface and searching for resources

goals: Provide positioning, navigation, and timing services
